definition: ephemeral (idiom)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
cloud/CL:朵[duo3]
(classical) to say
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: The original everything you say it is even a vapour.
sentences.chinese: 原来你所说的一切不过都是过眼云烟。

sentences.english: You say you love me, now all turn into even a vapour.
sentences.chinese: 你说的你爱我，现在全都变成了过眼云烟。

sentences.english: Even if such life the wealth piles up is also the eye mist.
sentences.chinese: 这样的人生即便财富堆积如山也不过是过眼云烟。

sentences.english: Wind and wave has already was vanish quickly.
sentences.chinese: 大风大浪已是过眼云烟。

sentences.english: But to you, all are fleeting souls.
sentences.chinese: 不过，那对你都是过眼云烟。

sentences.english: I am not sure this bubble that began six months ago is truly over.
sentences.chinese: 我不确信这场始于半年前的泡沫已经成为过眼云烟。

sentences.english: The answer is that the negatives all flutter away.
sentences.chinese: 答案是所有负面消息都将成为过眼云烟。

sentences.english: Glory is all well and good but, life is enough.
sentences.chinese: 荣耀只是过眼云烟，我们曾经活着就够了。

sentences.english: The blue emotions of the ancients has drowned over time as the past clouds and mist.
sentences.chinese: 古人的苍凉情怀如过眼云烟，留在了湮没的时光里。

definition: ephemeral (idiom)
illusion (Buddhism)/pipe dream
to regard as unimportant/to be indifferent to (fame, wealth etc)/(of an economy or a market) to slacken
The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
lit. froth and shadows/fig. illusion/mirage
floating clouds/fleeting/transient
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
to dismiss sth with a laugh (idiom)/to laugh it off
lit. flowers in a mirror and the moon reflected in the lake (idiom)/fig. an unrealistic rosy view/viewing things through rose-tinted spectacles/also written 水月鏡花|水月镜花
fame and profit
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
(literary) stranger
things have remained the same, but people have changed
